speaker: Monoco
line: He Who Guards Truth With Lies.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t mind a straightforward path for once. Better than battling through a mountain of Nevrons.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, Verso’s right. Something feels off.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Oh, I’m harmless, you don’t need those.

speaker: Verso
line: Well, if you’re harmless, then these weapons will stay harmless too.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Touché. Well. Visages invites you to join him in his chamber at the end of this path. I assume that’s why you’re here?

speaker: Sciel
line: Where do the other paths lead?

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: You’re free to traverse them. Masks are not just to obscure. They may also illuminate. Look for the masks that you need.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. Head straight to the Axon or take the other paths?

speaker: narrator
line: A mask. It seems connected to the Axon. It speaks.

speaker: Mask
line: He who painted this world. Seeking what he could not grasp. Longing to share with those he loves. Behind his smile, what could it be?

speaker: Sciel
line: Destroying these masks seems to hurt him.

speaker: Blooraga
line: Long ago, this island was just like any other. Some humans even decided to come and build their life here. Then the tremors came, the landscape changed, and… the humans were nowhere to be found… I hope we meet again! It’s a tad lonely around here.

speaker: Sciel
line: I know they’re Nevrons, but… witnessing the sorrow of others… I can’t help but feel for them.

speaker: Monoco
line: A noble but tremendously fatal impulse.

speaker: narrator
line: A mask. It seems connected to the Axon. It speaks.

speaker: Mask
line: He who lives in-between. Behind his veil, emotions swell. For a life forced to paint. What is he but a reflection of…

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah, it definitely hurts him. I think I saw one more path.

speaker: Monoco
line: Normally I enjoy a little destruction, but this doesn’t feel right.

speaker: narrator
line: A mask. It seems connected to the Axon. It speaks.

speaker: Mask
line: He who cannot fight fate. Behind his scowl, emotions blaze. But in the shadows, his temper fades. What am I but a mask of…

speaker: Maelle
line: I think that’s all of them.

speaker: Lune
line: We should be able to fight the Axon properly now.

speaker: Lune
line: Monoco, what does that mean, “He Who Guards Truth With Lies?”

speaker: Sciel
line: Guard as in protect? Or guard as in control?

speaker: Verso
line: I think you pissed him off.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: People want so badly to know, “What’s behind the mask?” Front, back. Recto, verso. Great art is both window and mirror. Whether it’s your mask or theirs.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: Child, we all need masks, but how you use them, mmm.

speaker: Sciel
line: This mask can’t hurt me. Because it is me.

speaker: Sciel
line: Axon down. Let’s bring this to the Curator.

speaker: Verso
line: That was Verso, wasn’t it? Renoir?

speaker: Maelle
line: Me? You want me to give it to you?

speaker: Maelle
line: I saw- I saw… It was… Renoir?

speaker: Verso
line: I used to see him in my nightmares too. He can be quite traumatising.

speaker: Verso
line: The next one will be harder.

speaker: Verso
line: The odds of killing Axons. “Close. But not zero.”

speaker: Maelle
line: You have nightmares too? About Renoir?

speaker: Monoco
line: Seems you were right about these Expeditioners. A most impressive group.

speaker: Verso
line: They’ve grown on you, haven’t they?

speaker: Verso
line: Hmmm. I recognize that look. What’s got you so grumpy?

speaker: Verso
line: Maybe stop losing your rocks then. How do you lose them anyway? Don’t you swallow the rocks?

speaker: Esquie
line: Sometimes… I laugh too hard. I can’t control myself and…

speaker: Verso
line: Okay, yeah, uh… I see… It’s, uh… hard to control.

speaker: narrator
line: Maelle finds a spot where she can write. She spends some time writing in Gustave’s journal, to honour his memory. She writes about how fearsome and incredible the Axons are, bigger than mountains. She hopes Gustave’s apprentices will read this journal someday.

speaker: Verso
line: Do you mind if I play here?

speaker: Maelle
line: What song was that? I feel like I know it.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, it’s an old song I used to play to my sister.

speaker: Verso
line: Sure, we, uh, we have all night. Okay, ready?

speaker: Verso
line: I am ready, I will need a bit of space. Alright. Esquie? You ready?
